title: Eclipse Attack Detection on a Blockchain Network
description: A novel non-parametric change detection algorithm is introduced to detect eclipse attacks on a blockchain network. The algorithm relies on empirical mean and variance, utilizing the Johnson-Lindenstrauss lemma for dimensionality reduction and monitoring changes in Fréchet mean and variance to identify attacks. The detector can be implemented as a smart contract, offering a tamper-proof solution.

title: Controlling Transaction Rate in Tangle Ledger: A Principal-Agent Approach
description: This paper introduces a principal-agent problem (PAP) framework to control transaction rates in Tangle, a directed acyclic graph-based distributed ledger. The proposed mechanism assigns proof of work (PoW) difficulty based on agents' computing power, enhancing security and moderating transaction rates. The framework solves a mixed-integer optimization problem, yielding optimal results that incentivize agents to perform challenging PoW and maintain a fair transaction rate across varying computing powers.

title: Favorite Quotes and Recommended Books
description: Discover a collection of favorite quotes from impactful books like 'Man's Search for Meaning' and 'And Every Morning the Way Home Gets Longer and Longer.' Plus, explore a curated list of recommended books by renowned authors such as Fredrik Backman, Markus Zusak, and Khaled Hosseini.

title: Free Static Website Hosting on GitHub with Custom Domain
description: Learn how to host a free static website using GitHub Pages. This guide walks you through setting up a GitHub repository for hosting static content like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. You'll also learn how to link a custom domain to your GitHub Pages site, making it accessible through a personalized URL.

title: Flyback Converter Project Overview
description: This project, conducted as part of a B.Tech requirement under Prof. Mukul C. Chandorkar at IIT Bombay, focuses on the application of a flyback converter in pre-charging module capacitors for a Modular Multilevel Converter (MMC). It also details the design of a multi-output flyback converter for powering Nixie tubes and microcontrollers. The documentation includes schematics and printed circuit board (PCB) designs.

title: Data Acquisition System for Epstein Tester
description: This project focuses on developing a data acquisition system for the Epstein tester, a device used to characterize magnetic materials by analyzing their B-H loop characteristics. The project aims to enhance the setup by integrating a built-in module that reduces reliance on bulky external components. The system utilizes an AD7768 ADC for 24-bit resolution at 256,000 samples per second and a DE0 Nano FPGA board for data transfer to a PC via UART protocol.

title: Measurement of Connectivity in Nanowire Network
description: This project focuses on designing an interface between a Keithley Source Measure Unit (SMU) and LabVIEW for two-probe and four-probe measurements of nanowire networks using a probe station. Additionally, it includes an interface for performing voltage and frequency sweeps for small voltage signals using an LCR meter. The project also entails a statistical analysis of the nanowire network's dimensions and electrical properties, utilizing ImageJ software to measure images obtained from Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM).

title: Special Edition Coins
description: Explore a collection of special edition coins celebrating significant milestones and events in Indian history. This gallery features coins commemorating the 50th anniversary of the United Nations, the 75 years of Dandi March, and the 150th birth anniversary of Motilal Nehru, among others. Each coin represents a unique aspect of India's cultural heritage and historical significance.

title: Homemade Bread Recipe
description: This comprehensive guide outlines the ingredients and equipment needed to make homemade bread. It covers essential steps such as proofing active dry yeast, making the dough, and baking the bread. Additionally, it provides tips for achieving the perfect texture and explains the differences between baking soda, baking powder, and yeast, along with references to further reading for aspiring bakers.
keywords: baking soda vs baking powder vs yeast

title: Stereovision Using More Than Two Image Sets
description: This project explores a method to extract depth information from multiple image sets to enhance the accuracy of depth maps. By averaging depth maps obtained from all valid pairs of images, the project aims to minimize unresolved pixels in the final depth map. A comparison with ground truth data obtained from a depth sensor is also included.

title: Support Vector Machine (SVM) Using Log-Barrier Method
description: This project explores the use of Support Vector Machines (SVM) for classification tasks. The SVM algorithm aims to generate an optimal separating hyperplane by maximizing the margin between two classes in a dataset using a constrained quadratic convex optimization formulation. The project employs the log-barrier method, an interior point approach, to handle inequality constraints in optimization problems, converging to a true solution through iterative adjustments of the penalty function parameter. The results showcase the effectiveness of the log-barrier method and central path technique in optimizing hyperplane placement for both linearly separable and inseparable data.

title: Testing of Digital Circuits Using Beaglebone Black
description: This project aims to develop a Python-based software application for the Beaglebone Black to debug and validate mock-up circuit designs on a breadboard. The strategy involves accepting device descriptions, scanning through all possible input sets for combinational circuits, and utilizing the Postman algorithm for state and transition analysis in sequential circuits. Results are displayed on a graphical user interface (GUI) that caters to both combinational and sequential circuits.

title: Shape Formation Using Kilobots
description: This project, part of lab work (SC 626), focuses on utilizing Kilobots to collaboratively form specified shapes. Guided by Prof. Leena Vachhani and Prof. Arpita Sinha, the project leverages Kilobots, low-cost robots designed at Harvard University's Self-organizing Systems Research Lab, which possess features like differential drive locomotion and on-board computation. The algorithm developed employs a finite state machine framework, incorporating an orbiting algorithm and a localization mechanism. The project outcomes are detailed in a report and presentation, with a flowchart illustrating the shape formation algorithm and a demonstration video showcasing the functionality.

title: Sketching
description: This section features various sketches captured through photography, showcasing personal moments and objects of interest. The included images highlight a selfie taken on September 16, 2016, and a photograph of a Sony headphone taken on the same date, reflecting a blend of personal expression and product representation.

title: Shared Economy for Battery Storage
description: This project explores the concept of shared battery storage as a strategy to minimize exposure to real-time electricity market fluctuations. Under the guidance of Prof. Ankur Kulkarni, the project involved a literature survey of game theoretic models focused on coalition benefits for electricity consumers amid dynamic tariff pricing policies. The findings highlight the advantages of shared battery resources over individual storage solutions, emphasizing long-term cost minimization through optimized battery sizing.

title: Interesting Solutions Based on Good Theories
description: A collection of resources showcasing interesting solutions based on theoretical frameworks, including participatory budgeting, fair allocation algorithms, and insights into animal behavior. This page provides links to platforms and papers that exemplify these concepts.

title: Pipeline RISC Architecture on FPGA
description: This project involved the design of a 6-stage pipelined processor based on a provided instruction set architecture. The processor, a 16-bit computer, follows the Little Computer Architecture and is designed to optimize performance through hazard mitigation techniques like forwarding and branch prediction.

title: Photography
description: A collection of photographs capturing memorable moments from various locations and experiences.

title: Classification of Image Features for Remote Sensing
description: A study comparing the efficiency of K-mean and C-mean clustering algorithms on satellite images for image feature classification.

title: Hysteresis Loop Modeling in Rolling and Transverse Direction of Grain Oriented Magnetic Material
description: This paper presents a comprehensive approach for modeling dynamic hysteresis loops in rolling and transverse directions of grain-oriented magnetic materials, utilizing magnetic viscosity-based methods and loss separation schemes.

title: Image Stitching for Arbitrary Camera Motion
description: This project aims to stitch multiple images obtained from arbitrary camera motion into a single panorama. A set of seven images captured in a hostel room was used for demonstration.

title: Generalized Hough Transform
description: This project extends the traditional Hough transform algorithm to detect arbitrary, non-parametric shapes with different scaling, using gradient information around the centroid of the shape.

title: IITB Fresher's Toolkit
description: A comprehensive guide for new students at IIT Bombay, covering email personalization, mail forwarding, software installation, and essential resources for academic success.

title: Hobbies
description: A collection of personal hobbies including photography, sketching, reading, playing musical instruments, and coin collecting.
